thread.title: Mum of Paige Doherty who was stabbed 150 times reveals new baby joy a year after teen's murder
thread.title_full: Mum of Paige Doherty who was stabbed 150 times reveals new baby joy a year after teen's murder

author: Joshua Taylor
title: Mum of Paige Doherty who was stabbed 150 times reveals new baby joy a year after teen's murder
text:
News Mum of Paige Doherty who was stabbed 150 times reveals new baby joy a year after teen's murder Twisted deli owner John Leathem, 32, was handed a life sentence for killing the schoolgirl and dumping her body in undergrowth Share Pamela Munro says Paige would have loved a baby sister (Photo: Daily Record) Share Get daily     
The mum of murdered teenager Paige Doherty has revealed she is expecting a baby. 
The joy comes almost exactly a year after the schoolgirl, 15, was brutally knifed to death by depraved deli owner John Leathem, 32 . 
Pamela Munro, 30, who has three other children, revealed she is due to give birth to a baby girl this summer. 
Pamela and husband Andy told the Clydebank Post : "It was always our intention to have a baby this year. We never planned it but when it happened it was a positive thing for us to focus on. 
"It will never replace Paige and we wouldn't want it to but we have always wanted a big family. 
"Paige would have loved a new wee sister." Paige was filmed going into Leathem's deli but never leaving again (Photo: Police Scotland/PA) John Leathem stabbed Paige nearly 150 times (Photo: PA) Read More Paige Doherty's killer stripped of assets as order served on bloodbath deli where she was brutally murdered 
The pair's other children are Andrew, 11, Peyton, 5, and Lucas, one. 
Paige was stabbed nearly 150 times in a sickening assault in Delicious Deli, the shop owned by Leathem in March last year. 
The 4ft 8ins schoolgirl went missing after a sleepover at a friendâ€™s home in Clydebank and was last seen buying a sausage roll from Leathem's shop. 
The schoolgirl was filmed on CCTV entering the deli at around 8.20am and never coming out. A forensic search at the scene where Paige's body was found (Photo: PA) Read More Paige Doherty's killer wins appeal to knock four years off his prison sentence for murdering the teenager 
Paige's body was found three days after she vanished in a wooded area behind a busy road connecting Clydebank and Glasgow. 
Leathem was jailed for a minimum of 27 years after he admitted killing the teenager, but this was later reduced to 23 years on appeal. 
He claimed he killed Paige because she threatened to claim he had "touched her" unless he gave her a job. 
He said he feared being placed on the sex offenders' register like had happened to a relative of his in an unrelated court case. Like us on Facebook
